section.p: Lifecycle notification EDRs are generated as a result of notification events for Lifecycle.

row.entry: The type of EDR generated by the NCC application.
The event for which the EDR was generated.
The identifier (ID) of the entity (Device, Group, Account, Subscription) for which the EDR was generated.

entry.p: Valid values: Device, Group, Account, Subscription
The reason for which the EDR was generated.

row.entry: The identifier of the notification template.
{APNRTRCOS=SPS, UNI=BYT, ACT=NOKIA, EVT=NOTRST, T=207, MDN=6246100001, USE=0, TOS=ADMN, TIM=1530181642, CID=C162461}
The identifier for the notification recipient.
This tag is available only for subscription entity.

entry.p: The name of the lifecycle attached to the entities that triggered the entity lifecycle.
This tag is available only when ELC (entity lifecycle) is triggered.
The name of the lifecycle attached to the entities that triggered the periodic lifecycle.
This tag is available only when PLC (periodic lifecycle) is triggered.

row.entry: The lifecycle state before the event.
The lifecycle state after the event.
When the notification is for device, this tag exists.
When the notification is for group, this tag exists.

concept.title: Disabling EDR for lifecycle send notification action

conbody.p: By default, EDR generation is enabled for send notification action in lifecycle.
To disable the EDR generation for this action, use the rule NOTIFICATION.Disable-Lifecycle-Notification-EDR.

concept.title: Disabling EDR logging for lifecycle actions

conbody.p: By default, EDR logging is enabled for lifecycle actions. To disable this, set the application preference Lifecycle CDR Logging Enabled to false.
